quest_title: Two equal and opposite forces are applied tangentially to a uniform disc of mass M and radius R as shown in the figure. If the disc is pivoted at its centre and free to rotate in its plane, the angular acceleration of the disc is
explanation_txt:
Torque \(\tau = I \alpha\)

\(\Rightarrow 2 F R=\cfrac{1}{2} M R^{2} \alpha\)

\(\Rightarrow \alpha=\cfrac{4 F}{M R}\)

explanation_plain_text: Torque

quest_title: Figure represents a glass plate placed vertically on a horizontal table with a beam of unpolarized light falling on its surface at the polarizing angle of 57o with the normal. The electric vector in the reflected light on screen S will vibrate with respect to the plane of incidence in a
ans3_txt: Plane making an angle of 45o with the vertical
ans4_txt: Plane making an angle of 57o with the horizontal
explanation_txt:
When unpolarized light is made incident at polarizing angle, the reflected light is plane polarized in a direction perpendicular to the plane of incidence.

Therefore, \(\vec { E }\) in reflected light will vibrate in vertical plane with respect to plane of incidence.
question_plain_title: Figure represents a glass plate placed vertically on a horizontal table with a beam of unpolarized light falling on its surface at the polarizing angle of 57o with the normal. explanation_plain_text:
When unpolarized light is made incident at polarizing angle, the reflected light is plane polarized in a direction perpendicular to the plane of incidence.

Therefore, in reflected light will vibrate in vertical plane with respect to plane of incidence.
ans3_plain_text: Plane making an angle of 45o with the vertical
ans4_plain_text: Plane making an angle of 57o with the horizontal

quest_title: Catalyst used in the hydrogenation of oil is:
explanation_txt:
Addition of \(H_2\) across unsaturated bond in the presence of Ni or Pt is called hydrogenation.

\(CH_2 = CH_2 + H_2 \xrightarrow[{Ni/Pt}]{\Delta} CH_3 - CH_3\)

quest_title: The speed of light in air is \(3\times 10^{8} \, \, m/s\). What will be its speed in diamond whose refractive index is 2.4
explanation_txt:
Speed of light is reduced in a medium according to its refractive index.

\(v=\cfrac{c}{\mu } =\cfrac{3\times 10^{8} }{2.4} =1.25\times 10^{8} m/s\)
question_plain_title: The speed of light in air is . What will be its speed in diamond whose refractive index is 2.4

\(\cfrac{1}{2} \mathrm{CV}^{2}=\mathrm{msd} \theta\)
or, \(\mathrm{V}=\sqrt{\cfrac{2 \mathrm{msd} \theta}{\mathrm{C}}}\)
\(\,\qquad=\sqrt{\cfrac{2 \times 0.1 \times 250 \times 0.4}{500 \times 10^{-6}}}=200 \mathrm{V}\)

explanation_txt:
The circuit can be redrawn as

The resistance 10\(\Omega\) and 10\(\Omega\) are in parallel.

So, \(R p E=R_{E Q}=\cfrac{10 \times 10}{20}=5 \Omega\)

\(\therefore R_{P Q}=5+5=10 \Omega\)

Then equivalent resistance between M and

N is \(R_{M N}=\cfrac{1}{5}+\cfrac{1}{10}+\cfrac{1}{5}\)

\(\therefore R_{M N}=2 \Omega\)

So, \(I=\cfrac{2}{2}=1\) Amp.

quest_title: An ellipse passes through the point (–3, 1) and its eccentricity is \(\sqrt { \cfrac { 2 } { 5 } }\). The equation of the ellipse is:
explanation_txt:
Let the equation of ellipse be \(\cfrac { x ^ { 2 } } { a ^ { 2 } } + \cfrac { y ^ { 2 } } { b ^ { 2 } } = 1\)

It passes through (– 3, 1)

So, \(\cfrac { 9 } { a ^ { 2 } } + \cfrac { 1 } { b ^ { 2 } } = 1 \Rightarrow 9 + \cfrac { a ^ { 2 } } { b ^ { 2 } } = a ^ { 2 }\).....(i)

Given eccentricity is \(\sqrt { 2 / 5 }\)

So, \(\cfrac { 9 } { a ^ { 2 } } + \cfrac { 1 } { b ^ { 2 } } = 1 \Rightarrow 9 + \cfrac { a ^ { 2 } } { b ^ { 2 } } = a ^ { 2 }\).....(ii)

From equation (i) and (ii), \(a ^ { 2 } = \cfrac { 32 } { 3 } , b ^ { 2 } = \cfrac { 32 } { 5 }\)

Hence required equation of ellipse is \(3 x ^ { 2 } + 5 y ^ { 2 } = 32\).

quest_title: One molar solution of \(\text{KMnO\({}_{4}\)}\) was titrated with acidified solution of \(\text{FeSO\({}_{4}\).}\) The strength of \(\text{KMnO\({}_{4}\)}\) solution will be taken as
explanation_txt:
The chemical equation for the equation

2KMnO\(_4\) + 8H\(_2\)SO\(_4\) + 10FeSO\(_4\) \(\rightarrow\) K\(_2\)SO\(_4\) + MnSO\(_4\) + 5Fe\(_2\)(SO\(_4\))\(_3\) + 8H\(_2\)O

Change in oxidation number of Mn in KMnO\(_4\) = 5

Equivalent Weight of KMnO\(_4\) = Molecular Weight/5

\(\therefore\) 1M KMnO\(_4\) solution = 5N

2KMnO + 8HSO + 10FeSO KSO + MnSO + 5Fe(SO) + 8HO

Change in oxidation number of Mn in KMnO = 5

Equivalent Weight of KMnO = Molecular Weight/5

1M KMnO solution = 5N

quest_title: If \(\cos ^{-1} \left(\cfrac{1}{x} \right)=\theta \), then \(\tan \theta \)=
explanation_txt:
Given that \(\cos ^{-1} \left(\cfrac{1}{x} \right)=\theta \, \, \Rightarrow \, \, \cos \theta =\cfrac{1}{x} \)

Now, \(\tan \theta =\cfrac{\sin \theta }{\cos \theta } =\cfrac{\sqrt{1-(1/x)^{2} } }{1/x} =\sqrt{x^{2} -1} \).

quest_title: The area of a triangle whose vertices are \(A\, (1,\, -1,\, 2),\) \(B\, (2,\, 1,\, -1)\) and \(C\, (3,\, -1,\, 2)\) is
explanation_txt:
Here \(\overrightarrow{OA} =i-j+2k\) and \(\overrightarrow{OB} =2i+j-k\) and \(\overrightarrow{OC} =3i-j+2k\)

These implies \(\overrightarrow{AB} =\overrightarrow{OB} -\overrightarrow{OA} =i+2j-3k\) and \(\overrightarrow{AC} =\overrightarrow{OC} -\overrightarrow{OA} =2i\)

Required area is given by \(=\cfrac{1}{2} |\overrightarrow{AB} \times \overrightarrow{AC} |\)

\[\overrightarrow{AB} \times \overrightarrow{AC} =\left|\begin{array}{ccc} {i} & {j} & {k} \\ {1} & {2} & {-3} \\ {2} & {0} & {0} \end{array}\right|=-2(3j+2k)\]

\(\Rightarrow \)Area of triangle \(=\cfrac{1}{2} \times 2|3j+2k|=\sqrt{13} \).

quest_title: \[\lim _ { x \rightarrow \infty } \sqrt { x } ( \sqrt { x + 5 } - \sqrt { x } ) =\]
explanation_txt: \[\begin{align} \lim _ { x \rightarrow \infty } \sqrt { x } ( \sqrt { x + 5 } - \sqrt { x } ) \times \cfrac { ( \sqrt { x + 5 } + \sqrt { x } ) } { ( \sqrt { x + 5 } + \sqrt { x } ) }= \lim _ { x \rightarrow \infty } \cfrac { \sqrt { x } ( 5 ) } { \sqrt { x } \left( \sqrt { 1 + \cfrac { 5 } { x } } + 1 \right) } = \cfrac { 5 } { 2 } \end{align}\]

explanation_txt: \(\cfrac { d } { d x } \log ( \log x ) = \cfrac { 1 } { x } \cdot \cfrac { 1 } { \log x } = ( x \log x ) ^ { - 1 }\)

quest_title: The value of \(\textit{a}\) so that the sum of the squares of the roots of the equation \(x^{2} -(a-2)x-a+1=0\) assume the least value, is
explanation_txt:
Let \(\alpha ,\; \beta \) be the roots of the equation :

\[x^{2} -(a-2)x-a+1=0,\]

then \(\alpha +\beta =a-2,\, \, \alpha \beta =-a+1\)

\[{\mkern1mu\raise1pt\hbox{.}\mkern1mu\raise4pt\hbox{.}\mkern1mu\raise1pt\hbox{.}\mkern1mu} z=\alpha ^{2} +\beta ^{2} =(\alpha +\beta )^{2} -2\alpha \beta \]

\[=(a-2)^{2} +2(a-1)=a^{2} -2a+2\]

\[\cfrac{dz}{da} =2a-2=0 \Rightarrow a=1\]

\[\cfrac{d^{2} z}{da^{2} } =2>0]

so \(\textit{z}\) has minima at \(a=1\)

So \(\alpha ^{2} +\beta ^{2} \) has least value for \(a=1\).

This is because we have only one stationary value at which we have minima. Hence \(\textit{a}=1\).

so has minima at

\(\mathrm{eV}=\cfrac{\mathrm{hc}}{\lambda}\)
or, \(\mathrm{V}=\cfrac{\mathrm{hc}}{\mathrm{e} \lambda}=\cfrac{6.62 \times 10^{-34} \times 3 \times 10^{8}}{1.6 \times 10^{-19} \times 10^{-10}}\)
\(\qquad\,=12412.5 \mathrm{V}=12.4 \times 10^{3} \mathrm{V}\)

quest_title: A body rolls down a star case of 5 steps. Each step has height 0.1m and width 0.1m then velocity of body at bottom will be
explanation_txt:
For vertical motion,

\(v_{y}=\sqrt{2 g h}=\sqrt{2 \times 10 \times 5 \times 0.1}=\sqrt{10} \mathrm{m} / \mathrm{s} \)
\(\mathrm{t}=\sqrt{\cfrac{2 \mathrm{h}}{\mathrm{g}}}=\sqrt{\cfrac{2 \times 0.5}{10}}=\sqrt{0.1} \mathrm{sec} \)

For horizontal motion,

\(\mathrm{v}_{\mathrm{x}}=\cfrac{\mathrm{R}}{\mathrm{t}}=\cfrac{5 \times 0.1}{\sqrt{0.1}}\)

\(=\quad \cfrac{5}{\sqrt{10}}=\sqrt{\cfrac{5}{2}} \mathrm{m} / \mathrm{s}\)

\(\begin{aligned} \therefore \mathrm{v} &=\sqrt{\mathrm{v}_{\mathrm{x}}^{2}+\mathrm{v}_{\mathrm{y}}^{2}}=\sqrt{\cfrac{5}{2}}+10 \\ &=\sqrt{\cfrac{25}{2}}=\cfrac{5}{\sqrt{2}} \mathrm{m} / \mathrm{s} \end{aligned}\)
question_plain_title: A body rolls down a star case of 5 steps. Each step has height 0.1m and width 0.1m then velocity of body at bottom will be
explanation_plain_text:
For vertical motion,


For horizontal motion,

quest_title: A spherical charged conductor has \(\text{\(\sigma\)}\) as the surface density of charge. The electric field on its surface is \(\text{E}\). If the radius of sphere is doubled keeping the surface, density of charge unchanged, what will be the electric field on the surface of new sphere?
explanation_txt:
\(E=\cfrac{1}{4 \pi \varepsilon_{0}} \cfrac{Q}{R^{2}}=\cfrac{1}{4 \pi \sigma_{0}} \times \cfrac{4 \pi R^{2} \sigma}{R^{2}}=\cfrac{\sigma}{\varepsilon_{0}}\)

This is independent of radius and depends on \(\sigma\) . Hence, the electric field on the surface of new sphere will be \(E\).

quest_title: A length 650cm of a potentiometer wire is required to balance the emf of a cell. When a resistor of 8? is connected across the terminals of the cell, the length required for balance is 520cm calculate the internal resistance of the cell
explanation_txt:
\(r=\left(\cfrac{l_{1}}{l_{2}}-1\right) R=\left(\cfrac{560}{500}-1\right) \times 8\)

\(\therefore r=2 \Omega\)

quest_title: A coil has 200 turns and area of 70 cm\({}^{2}\). The magnetic field perpendicular to the plane of coil is 0.3 Wb/m\({}^{2}\) and takes 0.1 sec to rotate through 180\(^\circ\). The value of induced emf will be
explanation_txt:
\(\text { Change in flux }(\Delta \phi)=2 \mathrm{BAN} \)
\(\begin{aligned} E=\cfrac{\Delta \phi}{\Delta t} &=\cfrac{2 \times 0.3 \times 70 \times 10^{-4}}{0.1} \times 200 \\ &=8.4 \mathrm{volt} \end{aligned} \)

\(\mathrm{P}=\mathrm{P}^{2} \mathrm{R}\)
or, \(\mathrm{R}=\cfrac{10}{0.5^{2}}=40 \Omega\)
\(\therefore \mathrm{Z}=\sqrt{\mathrm{R}^{2}+\mathrm{X}_{\mathrm{L}}^{2}}=\sqrt{40^{2}+25^{2}}=47.1 \Omega\)

quest_title: In a vessel containing \(\text{SO\(_{3}\),}\) \(\text{SO\(_{2}\)}\) and \(\text{O\(_{2}\)}\) at equilibrium some helium gas is introduced so that the total pressure increases while temperature and volume remain constant.  According to le chatelier's principle , the dissociation of \(\text{SO\(_{3 }\)}\)
explanation_txt:
Introducing inert gas at constant volume increases overall pressure. However, as there is no change in partial pressures, the reaction is unaffected.

When volume is allowed to change while changing total pressure, partial pressures also change, and then the reaction is affected.

quest_title: The solubility product of \(\text{PbCl\(_{2}\)}\) at \(35^{0}\)C is 2.56 x \(10^{- 4}\). The solubility of lead chloride per litre of the solution is
explanation_txt:
\(PbCl_2 \rightleftharpoons Pb^+ + 2Cl^-\)

Solubility product \( = [Pb^+][Cl^-]^2 = 4[PbCl_2]^3\)

So, \( [PbCl_2] = \sqrt[3]{\cfrac{2.56\times 10^{-4}}{4}} = 0.04 \)

quest_title: A train moves towards a stationary observer with the speed of 34m/sec. The train sounds a whistle and its frequency registered by the observer is \({f}_{1}\) . If the trains speed is reduced to 17m/sec, the frequency of registered is \({f}_{2}\). If the speed of sound is 340m/sec then the ratio \({f}_{1}/{f}_{2}\) is
explanation_txt: \(\begin{aligned} \mathrm{f}_{1} &=\left(\cfrac{v}{v-v_{\mathrm{g}}}\right) \times \mathrm{f}=\left(\cfrac{340}{340-34}\right) \times \mathrm{f} \\ &=\cfrac{10}{9} \times \mathrm{f} \\ \mathrm{f}_{2} &=\left(\cfrac{v}{v-v_{\mathrm{s}_{2}}}\right) \times \mathrm{f}=\left(\cfrac{340}{340-17}\right) \times \mathrm{f} \\ &=\cfrac{20}{19} \times \mathrm{f} \\ \cfrac{f_{1}}{f_{2}} &=\cfrac{19 \times 10}{20 \times 9}=\cfrac{19}{18} \end{aligned}\)

quest_title: Empirical formula of a compound is \(C H _ { 2 } O\)and its vapour density is 30. Molecular formula of the compound is
explanation_txt:
Empirical Formula \(= C H _ { 2 } O\)

Empirical formula mass \(= 12 + 2 + 16 = 30\)

Mol. Mass \(= 2 \times \mathrm { V.D. } = 2 \times 30 = 60\)

\(n = \cfrac { \text { Mol.mass } } { \text { Emperical mass } } = \cfrac { 60 } { 30 } = 2\)

Molecular formula \(=\) (Emperical formula)\(_ { n }\)

\(= \left( C H _ { 2 } O \right) _ { 2 } = C _ { 2 } H _ { 4 } O _ { 2 }\)
